intro: Ridsdalea eucodon, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of central Australia. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. The plant features slender, erect stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hair. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in racemes, blooming during the cooler months of spring and autumn. Ridsdalea eucodon plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for native pollinators.
